translated: He does not join or separate enlightenment and omniscience.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang byang chub tu mi sbyor mi 'byed do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang byang chub tu mi sbyor mi 'byed do //
translated: He does not join or separate omniscience and enlightenment.

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: Because he does not see even enlightenment.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: He does not see even omniscience.

original: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong na /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong na /
translated: Not seeing,

original: sbyor ba'am 'byed pa lta ga la yod /
analyzed: sbyor ba'am 'byed pa lta ga la yod /
translated: how could he join or separate them?

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: when bodhisattva great beings practice like this, it is said that they are dedicated to the perfection of wisdom.

original: sh'a @76b radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a @76b radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: further, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: gzugs dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: gzugs dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: they do not join form with the words ‘it exists as an entity.’

original: gzugs dngos po med ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: gzugs dngos po med ces bya bar mi sbyor ro // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dngos po yod ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: He does not apply the term ‘form is not a thing.’🔽He does not apply the term ‘feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness is a thing.’

original: rnam par shes pa dngos po med ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dngos po med ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: He does not apply the term ‘feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness is not a thing.’

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: Bodhisattva mahāsattvas practicing like that are said to be endeavoring in the perfection of wisdom.”

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra, when bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: gzugs rtag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: gzugs rtag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: they do not apply the term ‘form is permanent.’

original: gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: gzugs mi rtag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: They do not apply the term ‘form is impermanent.’🔽They do not apply the term ‘feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness is permanent.’

original: rnam par shes pa mi rtag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mi rtag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: They do not apply the term ‘feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness is impermanent.’

original: gzugs bde zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: gzugs bde zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: They do not apply the term ‘form is happiness.’

original: gzugs sdug bsngal zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: gzugs sdug bsngal zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: They do not apply the term ‘suffering’ to form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bde zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bde zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: They do not apply the term ‘happiness’ to feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa sdug bsngal zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa sdug bsngal zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: They do not apply the term ‘suffering’ to consciousness.

original: gzugs bdag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: gzugs bdag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: They do not apply the term ‘self’ to form.

original: gzugs bdag med ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: gzugs bdag med ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: They do not apply the term ‘selfless’ to form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bdag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa bdag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: They do not apply the term ‘self’ to feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa bdag med ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bdag med ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: They do not apply the term ‘selfless’ to consciousness.

original: gzugs zhi zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: gzugs zhi zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: They do not apply the term ‘calm’ to form.

original: gzugs ma zhi zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //🔽tshor ba dang / @77a *//
analyzed: gzugs ma zhi zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro // tshor ba dang / @77a *//
translated: They do not apply the term ‘not calm’ to form.🔽They do not apply the term ‘calm’ to feeling,

original: 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhi zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhi zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa ma zhi zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma zhi zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: They do not apply the term ‘not calm’ to consciousness.

original: gzugs stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: gzugs stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: He does not engage with the notion that physical forms are empty or that they are not empty.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa stong zhes bya ba'am mi stong zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: He does not engage with the notion that feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness are empty or that they are not empty.

original: gzugs mtshan ma yod ces bya ba'am mtshan ma med ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: gzugs mtshan ma yod ces bya ba'am mtshan ma med ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: He does not engage with the notion that physical forms are with signs or that they are signless.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mtshan ma yod ces bya ba'am mtshan ma med ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa mtshan ma yod ces bya ba'am mtshan ma med ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: He does not engage with the notion that feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness are with signs or that they are signless.

original: gzugs smon pa yod ces bya ba'am smon pa med ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: gzugs smon pa yod ces bya ba'am smon pa med ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: He does not engage with the notion that physical forms are having aspirations or that they are without aspirations.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa smon pa yod ces bya ba'am smon pa med ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa smon pa yod ces bya ba'am smon pa med ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: He does not engage with the notion that feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness are having aspirations or that they are without aspirations.

original: gzugs skye zhes bya ba'am 'gag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: gzugs skye zhes bya ba'am 'gag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: He does not engage with the notion that physical forms are arising or that they are ceasing.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa skye zhes bya ba'am 'gag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa skye zhes bya ba'am 'gag ces bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: He does not apply the term ‘arising’ or ‘ceasing’ to feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: gzugs 'das pa zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: gzugs 'das pa zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: He does not apply the term ‘past’ to form.

original: gzugs ma 'ongs pa zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: gzugs ma 'ongs pa zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: He does not apply the term ‘future’ to form.

original: gzugs da ltar byung pa zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: gzugs da ltar byung pa zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: He does not apply the term ‘present’ to form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa 'das pa zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa 'das pa zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: He does not apply the term ‘past’ to feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa ma 'ongs pa zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma 'ongs pa zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: He does not apply the term ‘future’ to consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa da ltar byung ba zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa da ltar byung ba zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: He does not apply the term ‘present’ to consciousness.

original: gzugs brtan zhes bya ba'am mi brtan zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: gzugs brtan zhes bya ba'am mi brtan zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: He does not apply the term ‘permanent’ or ‘impermanent’ to form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes @77b 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa brtan zhes bya ba'am mi brtan zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes @77b 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa brtan zhes bya ba'am mi brtan zhes bya bar mi sbyor ro //
translated: He does not apply the term ‘permanent’ or ‘impermanent’ to feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: de ni gzugs yod ces bya ba'am med ces bya bar mi sbyor mi 'byed do //
analyzed: de ni gzugs yod ces bya ba'am med ces bya bar mi sbyor mi 'byed do //
translated: He does not apply or divide up form as ‘existent’ or ‘non-existent.’

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yod ces bya ba'am med ces bya bar mi sbyor mi 'byed do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yod ces bya ba'am med ces bya bar mi sbyor mi 'byed do //
translated: He does not apply or divide up feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness as ‘existent’ or ‘non-existent.’

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yod ces bya ba'am med ces bya bar mi sbyor mi 'byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yod ces bya ba'am med ces bya bar mi sbyor mi 'byed do //
translated: He does not apply or divide up , up to and including the knowledge of all aspects, as ‘existent’ or ‘non-existent.’

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When he practices the perfection of wisdom,

original: spyod ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: spyod ces bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: he does not apprehend ‘practice.’

original: mi spyod ces bya bar mi dmigs so //🔽spyod kyang spyod la mi spyod kyang mi spyod ces bya bar mi dmigs so //🔽spyod pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: mi spyod ces bya bar mi dmigs so // spyod kyang spyod la mi spyod kyang mi spyod ces bya bar mi dmigs so // spyod pa'ang ma yin /
translated: He does not apprehend ‘non-practice.’🔽He does not apprehend ‘practice and also non-practice.’

original: mi spyod pa'ang ma yin zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
analyzed: mi spyod pa'ang ma yin zhes bya bar mi dmigs so //
translated: He does not apprehend ‘neither practice nor non-practice.’

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: a bodhisattva great being who practices like that is said to be ‘diligent in the perfection of wisdom.’

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Furthermore, Śāradvatīputra, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,🔽they do not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of the perfection of generosity.🔽They do not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //🔽tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don du /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do // tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don du /
translated: They do not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of inner emptiness,🔽up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.🔽They do not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of the emptiness of conditioned phenomena,🔽the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: the emptiness of what is beyond extremes,🔽the emptiness of the beginningless and endless,🔽the emptiness of nonrepudiation,

original: nang stong pa nyid nas /🔽dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid nas / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: the emptiness of inherent existence,🔽the emptiness of all phenomena,🔽the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics,🔽the emptiness of all things,🔽the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics,🔽the emptiness of nonobservation,🔽the emptiness of essential nature,🔽the emptiness of other things,🔽the emptiness of the nature of nonexistence,🔽the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics,🔽the emptiness of all things,🔽the emptiness of nonthings,🔽the emptiness of essence,🔽the emptiness of the essential nature of nonexistence,🔽the emptiness of the essential nature of existence,🔽the emptiness of essential nature,🔽the emptiness of the essential nature of nonexistence,🔽the emptiness of the essential nature of existence,🔽the emptiness of the essential nature of essential nature,🔽the emptiness of the ultimate,🔽the emptiness of the conditioned,🔽the emptiness of the unconditioned,🔽the emptiness of what is beyond extremes,🔽the emptiness of the beginningless and endless,🔽the emptiness of nonrepudiation,

original: skye ba med pa stong pa nyid dang 'gag pa @78a *//
analyzed: skye ba med pa stong pa nyid dang 'gag pa @78a *//
translated: the emptiness of inherent existence,🔽the emptiness of all phenomena,🔽the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics,🔽the emptiness of all things,🔽the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics,🔽the emptiness of nonobservation,🔽the emptiness of essential nature,🔽the emptiness of other things,🔽the emptiness of the nature of nonexistence,🔽the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics,🔽the emptiness of all things,🔽the emptiness of nonthings,🔽the emptiness of essence,🔽the emptiness of the essential nature of nonexistence,🔽the emptiness of the essential nature of existence,🔽the emptiness of essential nature,🔽the emptiness of the essential nature of non

original: med pa stong pa nyid kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: med pa stong pa nyid kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: They do not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of the emptiness of non-existence.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: They do not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of the irreversible stage.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: They do not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of bringing beings to maturity or purifying a buddha-field.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: They do not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the limbs of awakening, or the noble eightfold path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /🔽mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: the meditative stabilities, the immeasurable aspirations, the formless meditative concentrations, the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, emptiness,🔽signlessness, or aspirationlessness, or for the sake of the higher cognitions.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: They do not practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom for the sake of the meditative stabilities, or for the sake of the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: They do not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de bzhin @78b nyid dang chos kyi dbyings dang yang dag pa'i mtha'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: de bzhin @78b nyid dang chos kyi dbyings dang yang dag pa'i mtha'i don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: They do not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of suchness, the dharma-constituent, or the very limit of reality.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /🔽chos gang la yang tha dad pa'am /🔽bye brag gam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni / chos gang la yang tha dad pa'am / bye brag gam /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom🔽do not see any dharma as different,🔽as distinct,

original: khyad par du lta ba med de /
analyzed: khyad par du lta ba med de /
translated: or as special.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa ni /
translated: bodhisattva great beings practicing like that

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: are said to be striving in the perfection of wisdom.”🔽“Furthermore, Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should practice the perfection of wisdom with a mind that does not apprehend anything.

original: de lha'i mig gi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: de lha'i mig gi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: He does not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of the divine eye.

original: lha'i rna ba dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas dran pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa dang / zag pa zad pa'i ye shes kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
analyzed: lha'i rna ba dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas dran pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa dang / zag pa zad pa'i ye shes kyi don du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi spyod do //
translated: He does not practice the perfection of wisdom for the sake of the divine ear, for the knowledge of the minds of others, for the recollection of former lives, for the knowledge of magical powers, or for the knowledge of the destruction of the defilements.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Because when he practices the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong na /
translated: he does not even see the perfection of wisdom itself.

original: byang chub sems dpa' lta ci smos te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' lta ci smos te /
translated: How much less so a bodhisattva!

original: rnam pa thams cad du thams cad mngon par shes pa dmigs pa lta ga las 'ong /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du thams cad mngon par shes pa dmigs pa lta ga las 'ong /
translated: How could there be a bodhisattva who is an object of perception?

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: a bodhisattva great being who practices like this is said to be ‘endeavoring in the perfection of wisdom.’

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: 'di snyam du bdag gis rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la gnas te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du bdag gis rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams la gnas te /
translated: they do not think, “I will stand in the bases of supernatural power🔽and serve all the lord buddhas who are present, living, and remaining🔽in as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River

original: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang @79a *//🔽ji snyed bzhugs pa de dag thams cad pa rim gror bya'o //🔽bkur stir bya'o //
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang @79a *// ji snyed bzhugs pa de dag thams cad pa rim gror bya'o // bkur stir bya'o //
translated: in the eastern direction.🔽I will honor them,🔽I will venerate them,

original: bsti stang du bya'o //
analyzed: bsti stang du bya'o //
translated: I will respect them,

original: mchod par bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: mchod par bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: and I will make offerings to them.”🔽They do not think, “I will serve all the lord buddhas who are present, living, and remaining in as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River in the southern, western, northern,

original: lho dang nub dang byang dang / byang shar dang shar lho dang lho nub dang nub byang dang / 'og dang steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
analyzed: lho dang nub dang byang dang / byang shar dang shar lho dang lho nub dang nub byang dang / 'og dang steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
translated: northeastern, southeastern, southwestern, northwestern, lower, and upper directions.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed bzhugs ba de dag thams cad la rim gror bya'o //🔽bkur stir bya'o //🔽bsti stang du bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed bzhugs ba de dag thams cad la rim gror bya'o // bkur stir bya'o // bsti stang du bya'o //
translated: He does not think, ‘I will honor all the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who are present,🔽those who will appear in the future, and those who are appearing now in the ten directions.’🔽He does not think, ‘I will honor,

original: mchod par bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: mchod par bya'o snyam du mi sems so //
translated: revere, respect, and make offerings to them.’

original: de 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ci ston pa de dag thams cad lha'i rna bas mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: de 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ci ston pa de dag thams cad lha'i rna bas mnyan par bya'o //
translated: He does not think, ‘I will listen with divine hearing to all the teachings of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.’

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de dag gi sems can rnams kyi sems sems kyis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de dag gi sems can rnams kyi sems sems kyis shes par bya'o //
translated: He does not think, ‘I will know the minds of the sentient beings in those world systems with my own mind.’

original: de dag gi sngon gyi gnas bdag gis rjes su dran par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi sngon gyi gnas bdag gis rjes su dran par bya'o //
translated: He does not think, ‘I will remember my own previous lives and those of others.’

original: lha'i mig gis sems can de dag 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / skyes par gyur pa rnams bdag gis mthong bar bya'o //
analyzed: lha'i mig gis sems can de dag 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / skyes par gyur pa rnams bdag gis mthong bar bya'o //
translated: He does not think, ‘With my divine eye I will see the sentient beings in those world systems passing away and being reborn.’

original: sems can grangs med tshad med pa dag bdag gis yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya'o snyam du mi sems te /
analyzed: sems can grangs med tshad med pa dag bdag gis yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar bya'o snyam du mi sems te /
translated: He does not think, ‘I will lead countless, innumerable sentient beings to complete nirvāṇa.’

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices like that is said to be endeavoring in the perfection of wisdom.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: further, when the bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the perfection of wisdom,

original: bdud glags tshol zhing nyams bskyod pa rnams kyis kyang glags mi rnyed de /
analyzed: bdud glags tshol zhing nyams bskyod pa rnams kyis kyang glags mi rnyed de /
translated: even the māras who seek an opportunity and try to find fault do not find an opportunity.

original: 'jig @79b rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bya ba gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyang lhun gyis grub pa dang / yongs su brtag pa med par mthun par 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'jig @79b rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bya ba gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyang lhun gyis grub pa dang / yongs su brtag pa med par mthun par 'grub bo //
translated: All the mundane and supramundane activities that there are are all accomplished spontaneously and without investigation.

original: 'jig rten pa'i nyon mongs pa gang ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyang rab tu bsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i nyon mongs pa gang ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad kyang rab tu bsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All the mundane afflictions that there are are also completely eliminated.

original: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
translated: In the eastern direction, in as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed bzhugs pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed bzhugs pa de dag kyang /
translated: All the blessed buddhas who are present

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la /
translated: protect that bodhisattva great being

original: nyan thos kyi sa 'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung du 'ong ngo zhes srung ba mdzad do //🔽rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams dang / mtshe ma dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams dang / tshangs ris kyi lha rnams dang / tshangs lha nye phan dang /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa 'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung du 'ong ngo zhes srung ba mdzad do // rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams dang / mtshe ma dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams dang / tshangs ris kyi lha rnams dang / tshangs lha nye phan dang /
translated: so that he does not fall to the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level.🔽The four great kings, the gods of the Thirty-Three, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin gods, the Brahmakāyika gods, the Brahmapurohita gods,

original: tshangs pa kun 'khor dang / tshangs chen dang / snang pa dang / chung snang dang / tshad med snang pa dang / kun snang dang ba dang / dge ba dang / chung dge dang / tshad med dge ba dang / dge rgyas dang / che ba dang /
analyzed: tshangs pa kun 'khor dang / tshangs chen dang / snang pa dang / chung snang dang / tshad med snang pa dang / kun snang dang ba dang / dge ba dang / chung dge dang / tshad med dge ba dang / dge rgyas dang / che ba dang /
translated: the Brahmapārṣadya gods, the Mahābrahma gods, the Ābhā gods, the Parīttābha gods, the Apramāṇābha gods, the Ābhāsvara gods, the Śubha gods, the Parīttaśubha gods, the Apramāṇaśubha gods, the Śubhakṛtsna gods, the Bṛhatphala gods,

original: chung che dang / tshad med che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / shin tu mthong ba dang / gya nom snang ba dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la /
analyzed: chung che dang / tshad med che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / shin tu mthong ba dang / gya nom snang ba dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la /
translated: the gods of the Brahma-group, the gods of the Brahmapurohita, the gods of the Brahmakāyika, the gods of Parīttābha, the gods of Apramāṇābha, the gods of Ābhāsvara, the gods of Parīttaśubha, the gods of Apramāṇaśubha, the gods of Śubhakṛtsna, the gods of Bṛhatphala, the gods of Avṛha, the gods of Atapa, the gods of Sudarśana, and the gods of Akaniṣṭha,🔽

original: la la zhig bar chad byed par 'gyur du 'ong ngo zhes yongs su srung ba byed do //🔽de la lus kyi skyon du bya ba gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag kyang tshe 'di nyid la thams cad du @80a *//
analyzed: la la zhig bar chad byed par 'gyur du 'ong ngo zhes yongs su srung ba byed do // de la lus kyi skyon du bya ba gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag kyang tshe 'di nyid la thams cad du @80a *//
translated: the gods of the Heaven of Limited Radiance, the gods of the Heaven of Immeasurable Radiance, the gods of the Heaven of Lustrous Radiance, the gods of the Heaven of Limited Virtue, the gods of the Heaven of Immeasurable Virtue, the gods of the Heaven of Perfected Virtue, the gods of the Heaven of No Hardship, the gods of the Heaven of Good Vision, the gods of the Heaven of Excellent Vision, and the gods of the Highest Heaven, will guard him, thinking, ‘May no one create obstacles for this bodhisattva great being!’

original: thams cad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever physical faults there are, all of them will be completely absent in this very life.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de sems can thams cad la byams pas khyab par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de sems can thams cad la byams pas khyab par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because this bodhisattva great being is pervaded by love for all sentient beings.

original: lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
analyzed: lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na /
translated: in the south, west, north, northeast, southeast, southwest, northwest, below, and above,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed bzhugs pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang ji snyed bzhugs pa de dag kyang /
translated: all the blessed buddhas in each of the directions, in world systems as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges river,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la nyan thos kyi sa 'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung du 'ong ngo zhes yongs su srung ba mdzad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la nyan thos kyi sa 'am rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung du 'ong ngo zhes yongs su srung ba mdzad do //
translated: protect the bodhisattva mahāsattva, so that he does not fall to the level of the śrāvakas or the level of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams dang / mtshe ma dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams dang / tshangs ris kyi lha rnams dang / tshangs lha nye phan dang /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha rnams dang / mtshe ma dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams dang / tshangs ris kyi lha rnams dang / tshangs lha nye phan dang /
translated: The four great kings, the Trāyastriṃśa gods, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin gods, the Brahmakāyika gods, the Brahmapurohita gods,

original: tshangs pa kun 'khor dang / tshangs chen dang / snang ba dang / chung snang dang / tshad med snang ba dang / kun snang dang ba dang / dge ba dang / chung dge dang / tshad med dge ba dang / dge rgyas dang / che ba dang /
analyzed: tshangs pa kun 'khor dang / tshangs chen dang / snang ba dang / chung snang dang / tshad med snang ba dang / kun snang dang ba dang / dge ba dang / chung dge dang / tshad med dge ba dang / dge rgyas dang / che ba dang /
translated: Brahmakayika, Brahmapurohita, Mahabrahma, Parittabha, Apramanabha, Abhasvara, ParittaShubha, Apramanashubha, Shubhakrisha, Bhavagra,

original: chung che dang / tshad med che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / shin tu mthong ba dang / gya nom snang ba dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la /
analyzed: chung che dang / tshad med che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / shin tu mthong ba dang / gya nom snang ba dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de la /
translated: Brahmakāyika, Brahmapurohita, Mahābrahma, Parīttābha, Apramāṇābha, Ābhāsvara, Parīttaśubha, Apramāṇaśubha, Śubhakṛtsna, Bṛhatphala, Avṛha, Atapa, Sudarśana, and Akaniṣṭha.

original: la la zhig bar chad byed par 'gyur du 'ong ngo zhes yongs su srung ba byed do //
analyzed: la la zhig bar chad byed par 'gyur du 'ong ngo zhes yongs su srung ba byed do //
translated: They will think, ‘We must protect this bodhisattva mahāsattva from any harm.’

original: de la lus kyi skyon du bya @80b ba gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyang /
analyzed: de la lus kyi skyon du bya @80b ba gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyang /
translated: Whatever physical faults he may have will all

original: tshe 'di nyid la thams cad du thams cad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la thams cad du thams cad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: disappear in this very life.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de sems can thams cad la byams pas khyab par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de sems can thams cad la byams pas khyab par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the bodhisattva mahāsattva has pervaded all beings with love.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson zhes bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices like this is said to be diligent in the perfection of wisdom.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe gzungs kyi sgo dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang / spobs pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa'i sgo dag kyang tshegs mi che bar mngon du 'gyur ro //

translated: further, when the bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the perfection of wisdom, the dhāraṇī gateways, the samādhi gateways, eloquence, and the gateways of the correct understandings will manifest without difficulty.

original: skye ba'i skye mched thams cad du'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mnyes par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba'i skye mched thams cad du'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mnyes par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: In all the places of birth, he will please the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly enlightened buddhas.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du /
translated: and until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they will never be separated from those lord buddhas.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Moreover, Śāradvatī­putra,

translated: when great bodhisattva beings practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom,

analyzed: 'phrad pa'am mi 'phrad par 'gyur ba de lta bu yod dam zhes bya bar mi sems so //

analyzed: pa'am / 'phrad pa'am mi 'phrad par 'gyur ba de lta bu yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: Because they do not see any phenomenon that would combine or separate, or meet or not meet, with any other phenomenon.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Moreover, Śāradvatī­putra,

analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor 'di ni rnal 'byor dam pa ste /

analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ngo //

analyzed: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed do //

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu'ang myur du mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: rnal 'byor du bya ba gang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor du bya ba gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: whatever yogas there are,

original: de dag gi nang na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor de ni rab ces bya /
analyzed: de dag gi nang na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor de ni rab ces bya /
translated: among them, the yoga of the perfection of wisdom is called the best,

original: mchog dang / dam pa dang / phul dang / gtso bo dang / gya nom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mchog dang / dam pa dang / phul dang / gtso bo dang / gya nom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the supreme, the sublime, the excellent, the foremost, and the exquisite.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor 'di ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor 'di ni /

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnal 'byor te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnal 'byor te /
translated: the yoga of emptiness, the yoga of signlessness, and the yoga of wishlessness.

original: bla na med pa'i rnal 'byor to //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i rnal 'byor to //
translated: This is the unsurpassed yoga.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: de ltar brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni lung bstan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni lung bstan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices in this way is said to be prophesied.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nye bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nye bar gyur pa'o //
translated: He has approached unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: de ltar brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can tshad med grangs med pa'i don byed kyang /🔽de 'di snyam du bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pa yin no zhe'am /
analyzed: de ltar brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can tshad med grangs med pa'i don byed kyang / de 'di snyam du bdag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson pa yin no zhe'am /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices in this way accomplishes the aims of countless, limitless beings.🔽He does not think, ‘I am practicing the perfection of wisdom,’

original: brtson pa ma yin no zhes bya bar mi sems so; ;bdag la ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams lung ston pa mdzad do //
analyzed: brtson pa ma yin no zhes bya bar mi sems so; ;bdag la ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams lung ston pa mdzad do //
translated: or ‘I am not practicing.’ He thinks, ‘The lord buddhas will prophesy to me.

original: bdag ni lung bstan pa la nye bar gyur to //
analyzed: bdag ni lung bstan pa la nye bar gyur to //
translated: I am approaching the prophecy.’

original: bdag gis ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //🔽bdag gis ni @83a *//
analyzed: bdag gis ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang bar bya'o // bdag gis ni @83a *//
translated: I will purify a buddhafield.

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya'o //
