analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu @88b phyin pa drug la spyod pa dag /
translated: in the same way, bodhisattva great beings practicing the six perfections

original: dang po sems bskyed pa nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par bzhugs nas /
analyzed: dang po sems bskyed pa nyid kyis byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par bzhugs nas /
translated: from the first arousal of the mind of awakening remain in the bodhisattva’s faultlessness🔽and

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa 'thob pa'ang yod do //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa 'thob pa'ang yod do //
translated: and there are those who attain the irreversible stage.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang po sems bskyed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang po sems bskyed pa nyid kyis /
translated: it is like this: There are great bodhisattva beings who, from the very outset of their spiritual practice,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya zhing /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya zhing /
translated: are manifestly, perfectly awakened to unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment,

original: mngon par sangs rgyas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te /
analyzed: mngon par sangs rgyas nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te /
translated: and having become manifestly, perfectly awakened, turn the wheel of the sacred doctrine,

original: sems can tshad med grangs med pa'i don byas nas /
analyzed: sems can tshad med grangs med pa'i don byas nas /
translated: and having benefited countless, innumerable sentient beings,

original: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' zhing /
analyzed: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' zhing /
translated: pass into final nirvāṇa in the expanse of nirvāṇa that is free from the substratum of corporeal reality.

original: de dag yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas kyang /🔽dam pa'i chos bskal pa'am /
analyzed: de dag yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas kyang / dam pa'i chos bskal pa'am /
translated: And after they have passed into final nirvāṇa,🔽their sacred teachings remain for an eon

original: bskal pa bas lhag par gnas pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: bskal pa bas lhag par gnas pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: or even longer than an eon.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang po sems bskyed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang po sems bskyed pa nyid kyis /
translated: it is like this: There are great bodhisattva beings who, from the very outset of their spiritual practice,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor la snyoms par 'jug cing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rnal 'byor la snyoms par 'jug cing /
translated: They are absorbed in the yoga of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de dag byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dang lhan cig sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams blta ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i don du 'dong ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: de dag byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dang lhan cig sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams blta ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i don du 'dong ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: They go from buddha realm to buddha realm together with many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of bodhisattvas in order to see the lord buddhas, to bring beings to maturity, and to purify a buddha realm.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: there are bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: bsam gtan bzhi thob pa /🔽tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med @89a *//
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi thob pa / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med @89a *//
translated: who have attained the four concentrations,

original: pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi thob pa dag /
analyzed: pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi thob pa dag /
translated: the four immeasurables, and the four formless absorptions,

original: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gis tshul du mar rnam par rtse zhing /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gis tshul du mar rnam par rtse zhing /
translated: who play with those concentrations, immeasurables, and formless absorptions in many ways,🔽and who, having played with them,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: They enter into the first concentration.

original: de dag bsam gtan dang po de las langs nas /
analyzed: de dag bsam gtan dang po de las langs nas /
translated: Having arisen from that first concentration,

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la mnyam par gzhog go /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la mnyam par gzhog go /
translated: they rest in equipoise in the meditative absorption of cessation.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las langs nas /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las langs nas /
translated: Having arisen from the meditative absorption of cessation,

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: they enter into the second concentration.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa las langs nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa las langs nas /
translated: Having arisen from the second concentration,

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la mnyam par gzhog go /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la mnyam par gzhog go /
translated: they rest in equipoise in the meditative absorption of cessation.

original: de las langs nas bsam gtan gsum pa la snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: de las langs nas bsam gtan gsum pa la snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: Having arisen from that, they enter into the third concentration.

original: de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la mnyam par gzhog go /
analyzed: de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la mnyam par gzhog go /
translated: Having arisen from that, they rest in equipoise in the meditative absorption of cessation.

original: de las langs nas bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: de las langs nas bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: Having arisen from that, they enter into the fourth concentration.

original: de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la mnyam par gzhog go /
analyzed: de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la mnyam par gzhog go /
translated: Having arisen from that, they rest in equipoise in the meditative absorption of cessation.

original: de las langs nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la'ang snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: de las langs nas nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la'ang snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: Having arisen from that, they enter into the meditative absorption of the sense field of infinite space.

original: de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la mnyam par gzhog go /
analyzed: de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la mnyam par gzhog go /
translated: Having risen from that, he enters into the meditative absorption of cessation.

original: de las langs nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: de las langs nas rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: Having risen from that, he enters into the meditative absorption of the base of infinite consciousness.

original: de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la mnyam par gzhog go /
analyzed: de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la mnyam par gzhog go /
translated: Having risen from that, he enters into the meditative absorption of cessation.

original: de las langs nas cung zad med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: de las langs nas cung zad med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: Having risen from that, he enters into the meditative absorption of the base of nothingness.

original: de las langs nas 'gog @89b pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la mnyam par gzhog go /
analyzed: de las langs nas 'gog @89b pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la mnyam par gzhog go /
translated: Having risen from that, he enters into the meditative absorption of cessation.

original: de las langs nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: de las langs nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: Having risen from that, he enters into the meditative absorption of the base of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la mnyam par gzhog go /
analyzed: de las langs nas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la mnyam par gzhog go /
translated: Having risen from that, he enters into the meditative absorption of cessation.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa rnams bsam gtan dang // tshad med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag yang dang yang du rnam par mnan cing snyoms par 'jug pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa rnams bsam gtan dang // tshad med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag yang dang yang du rnam par mnan cing snyoms par 'jug pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: Thus, there are bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom, who are endowed with skill in means, who repeatedly enter into and emerge from these meditative stabilities, immeasurables, concentrations, and absorptions.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa thob pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa thob pa /
translated: there are also bodhisattva great beings who have attained the applications of mindfulness, right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and eightfold noble path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the eight liberations,🔽the nine serial steps of meditative absorption,🔽emptiness,🔽signlessness,🔽wishlessness,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams thob pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams thob pa /
translated: the superknowledges,🔽the meditative stabilities,

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams thob pa /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams thob pa /
translated: and the dhāraṇī gateways,🔽the ten powers of the tathāgatas,🔽the four fearlessnesses,🔽the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad thob pa dang / rnam @90a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad thob pa dang / rnam @90a *//
translated: and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.

original: par thar pa'i sgo gsum po thob kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub thob par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: par thar pa'i sgo gsum po thob kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub thob par mi byed kyi /
translated: “They attain the three gates to liberation, but they do not attain the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, or individual enlightenment.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing /
translated: They practice the perfection of wisdom

original: thabs mkhas pas yongs su bzung bas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa sems can rnams la ston par byed de /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pas yongs su bzung bas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa sems can rnams la ston par byed de /
translated: and, through being taken hold of by skillful means, they teach the noble eightfold path to sentient beings.

original: sems can de dag des rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub thob par 'gyur bar byed pa dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: sems can de dag des rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ba dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub thob par 'gyur bar byed pa dag kyang yod de /
translated: They cause those sentient beings to attain the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, and individual enlightenment.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa yin te /
translated: The knowledge that attains the result of a śrāvaka or a pratyekabuddha is the patience of bodhisattva great beings.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de lta bus de ltar rnam par spyod pa de dag ni phyir mi ldog pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de lta bus de ltar rnam par spyod pa de dag ni phyir mi ldog pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: one should know that those bodhisattva great beings who practice like that with that perfection of wisdom are irreversible.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu / 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,🔽it is like this: there are bodhisattva great beings who, abiding in the six perfections,

original: dga' ldan gyi gnas yongs su sbyong ba dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: dga' ldan gyi gnas yongs su sbyong ba dag kyang yod de /
translated: purify the Tuṣita realm.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni bskal pa bzang po par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni bskal pa bzang po par shes par bya'o //
translated: one should know that those bodhisattva great beings are in the Fortunate Eon.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di @90b ltar  yang  byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: 'di @90b ltar  yang  byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: In this way, Śāradvatī­putra, there are great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom,

original: bsam gtan bzhi thob pa /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi thob pa /
translated: who have attained the four meditative concentrations,

original: tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun thob pa /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun thob pa /
translated: who have attained the four immeasurable aspirations and the four formless absorptions, and who have attained the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment,

original: mngon par shes pa drug thob pa /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug thob pa /
translated: who have attained the six extrasensory powers,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad thob pa dag 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi khong du chud par bya ba'i don du spyod kyang; bden pa bzhi rtogs par mi byed pa dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad thob pa dag 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi khong du chud par bya ba'i don du spyod kyang; bden pa bzhi rtogs par mi byed pa dag kyang yod de /
translated: who have attained the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, and who, although they practice in order to comprehend the four noble truths, do not realize the four truths.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni tshe gcig gis thogs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni tshe gcig gis thogs par shes par bya'o //
translated: one should know that those great bodhisattva beings are impeded by only one birth.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa dag 'jig rten gyi khams nas 'jig rten gyi khams su 'dong zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa dag 'jig rten gyi khams nas 'jig rten gyi khams su 'dong zhing /
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra, there are also great bodhisattva beings who, while practicing the six transcendent perfections, proceed from world system to world system.

original: de dag gi sems can rnams byang chub tu yang dag par bskul ba byed cing /
analyzed: de dag gi sems can rnams byang chub tu yang dag par bskul ba byed cing /
translated: They encourage sentient beings to attain enlightenment,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa dag kyang yod de /
translated: and they purify a buddhafield.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni bskal pa grangs med tshad med pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag ni bskal pa grangs med tshad med pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: those great bodhisattva beings will attain manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment after an inexpressible number of eons.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing sems can rnams kyi don du rtag @91a *//
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu / 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing sems can rnams kyi don du rtag @91a *//
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: par brtson te /
analyzed: par brtson te /
translated: there are also great bodhisattva beings who, while abiding in the six transcendent perfections, constantly strive for the sake of sentient beings.

original: nam yang gnod par 'gyur ba'i tshig mi smra /
analyzed: nam yang gnod par 'gyur ba'i tshig mi smra /
translated: They never speak words that are harmful.

original: gnod pa dang ldan pa'i lus kyi las dang / yid kyi las mi byed pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: gnod pa dang ldan pa'i lus kyi las dang / yid kyi las mi byed pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: There are those who do not perform any physical, verbal, or mental actions that are harmful.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing sems can gyi don du rtag tu brtson pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing sems can gyi don du rtag tu brtson pas /
translated: there are bodhisattva great beings who, abiding in the six perfections, constantly strive for the sake of sentient beings,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'dong zhing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'dong zhing /
translated: going from buddhafield to buddhafield,

original: sems can rnams kyi ngan song gi lam gsum po rgyun gcod pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi ngan song gi lam gsum po rgyun gcod pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: and who cut off the three lower realms of sentient beings.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te /
translated: there are bodhisattva great beings who, abiding in the six perfections, prioritize the perfection of generosity,

original: sems can rnams kyi bde ba'i yo byad thams cad nye bar bsgrub cing /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi bde ba'i yo byad thams cad nye bar bsgrub cing /
translated: and who provide all the necessities for the happiness of sentient beings.

original: zas 'dod pa rnams la zas dang / skom 'dod pa rnams la skom dang / bzhon pa 'dod pa rnams la bzhon pa dang / me tog dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / mal stan dang / gos dang / rgyan dang /
analyzed: zas 'dod pa rnams la zas dang / skom 'dod pa rnams la skom dang / bzhon pa 'dod pa rnams la bzhon pa dang / me tog dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / mal stan dang / gos dang / rgyan dang /
translated: They satisfy those who want food with food, those who want drink with drink, those who want vehicles with vehicles, those who want flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, aromatic powders, and ointments with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, aromatic powders, and ointments, those who want dwellings with dwellings, those who want lamps with lamps, those who want bedding with bedding, those who want servants with servants, those who want vessels with vessels, those who want jewels with jewels, those who want shelter with shelter, those who want wives with wives, and those who want homes with homes.

original: 'tsho ba dang / khyim 'dod pa rnams la khyim gyis yongs su sdud cing 'tsho ba'i yo byad skyon med pa yongs su bsgrub pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: 'tsho ba dang / khyim 'dod pa rnams la khyim gyis yongs su sdud cing 'tsho ba'i yo byad skyon med pa yongs su bsgrub pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: They satisfy them with all the necessities of life, providing them with all the requisites of life without any deficiency.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te /
translated: “There are those who, having made the perfection of morality their priority,

original: sems can rnams lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sdom pa la rab tu 'god pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: sems can rnams lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sdom pa la rab tu 'god pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: establish sentient beings in the restraint of body, speech, and mind.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te /
translated: “There are those who, having made the perfection of patience their priority,

original: sems can rnams khro ba med pa dang / gnod sems med pa la rab tu 'god pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: sems can rnams khro ba med pa dang / gnod sems med pa la rab tu 'god pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: establish sentient beings in the absence of anger and the absence of malice.

original: brtson @91b 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te /
analyzed: brtson @91b 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te /
translated: “There are those who, having made the perfection of effort their priority,

original: sems can rnams dge ba'i chos thams cad la mngon par brtson pa la rab tu 'god pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: sems can rnams dge ba'i chos thams cad la mngon par brtson pa la rab tu 'god pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: They establish sentient beings in the practice of all virtuous qualities.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te /
translated: They make the perfection of concentration their priority.

original: sems can rnams zhi gnas rtse gcig tu bya ba dang / 'dod pa las dben pa la rab tu 'god pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: sems can rnams zhi gnas rtse gcig tu bya ba dang / 'dod pa las dben pa la rab tu 'god pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: They establish sentient beings in the practice of tranquility and one-pointedness, and in the practice of solitude.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te //
translated: They make the perfection of wisdom their priority.

original: sems can rnams chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med par 'god pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: sems can rnams chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med par 'god pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: They establish sentient beings in the practice of non-attachment to all phenomena.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
translated: in the same way, bodhisattva great beings, abiding in the six perfections,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhur byas te /
translated: make the perfection of wisdom their priority.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba'i lus su mngon par sprul te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba'i lus su mngon par sprul te /
translated: They emanate bodies that are just like the bodies of the thus-gone ones.

original: sems can dmyal ba'i sems can rnams dang / byol song gi skye gnas pa'i sems can rnams dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can rnams la ngan song thams cad las yang dag par 'da' ba'i phyir chos ston pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i sems can rnams dang / byol song gi skye gnas pa'i sems can rnams dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can rnams la ngan song thams cad las yang dag par 'da' ba'i phyir chos ston pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: They teach the Dharma to the beings in the hells, to the beings in the animal world, and to the beings in the world of Yama, in order to completely transcend all miserable realms.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
translated: in the same way, bodhisattva great beings, abiding in the six perfections,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba'i lus su mngon par sprul nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba'i lus su mngon par sprul nas /
translated: having emanated bodies like the bodies of the buddhas,

original: shar phyogs kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyad dag tu 'dong zhing sems can rnams la chos ston pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / chos nyan cing byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyad dag tu 'dong zhing sems can rnams la chos ston pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / chos nyan cing byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang /
translated: go to the buddhafields in the eastern direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, and teach the Dharma to sentient beings, serve the thus-gone ones, listen to the Dharma, and see the bodhisattva saṅgha.

original: @92a *// sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong bar byed cing /
analyzed: @92a *// sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong bar byed cing /
translated: They also cause them to see the distinctions of the qualities of the buddhafields.

original: de dag sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag gi mtshan ma yongs su bzung ste /
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag gi mtshan ma yongs su bzung ste /
translated: They take up the signs of those buddhafields.

original: de bas kyang rgya che ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po yongs su bsgrub cing /
analyzed: de bas kyang rgya che ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po yongs su bsgrub cing /
translated: They establish many buddhafields that are even vaster and more sublime than those.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshe gcig gis thogs pa sha stag skye bar byed pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshe gcig gis thogs pa sha stag skye bar byed pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: They cause bodhisattva great beings who are only one birth away from awakening to be born in those buddhafields.

original: de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing /
translated: In the same way, in the southern, western, northern, northeastern, southeastern, southwestern, and northwestern directions, below and above, in each direction,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu 'dong zhing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu 'dong zhing /
translated: they go to as many buddhafields as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River.

original: sems can rnams la chos ston pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / chos nyan cing byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong bar byed cing /
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos ston pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / chos nyan cing byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba dag kyang mthong bar byed cing /
translated: They teach the Dharma to sentient beings, serve the thus-gone ones, listen to the Dharma, and see the qualities of the bodhisattva saṅgha and the buddha realms.

original: de dag sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag gi mtshan ma yongs su bzung ste /
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag gi mtshan ma yongs su bzung ste /
translated: They take note of the characteristics of those buddha realms.

original: de bas kyang rgya che ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po yongs su bsgrub cing /
analyzed: de bas kyang rgya che ba khyad par du 'phags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing mang po yongs su bsgrub cing /
translated: They accomplish many buddha realms that are even vaster and more exalted than those.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshe gcig gis thogs pa sha stag skye bar byed pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshe gcig gis thogs pa sha stag skye bar byed pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: They cause bodhisattva great beings who are only one birth away from awakening to be born in those buddha realms.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: in the same vein, bodhisattva great beings who practice the six perfections

original: mi chen po'i mtshan @92b sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan par byas te /
analyzed: mi chen po'i mtshan @92b sum cu rtsa gnyis dang ldan par byas te /
translated: They will have the thirty-two marks of a great man.

original: dbang po gsal zhing yongs su dag pa dang ldan par gyur nas /
analyzed: dbang po gsal zhing yongs su dag pa dang ldan par gyur nas /
translated: They will have clear and pure faculties.

original: de dag lus yongs su dag pa de dag gis skye po mang po dga' ba dang mos pa bskyed de /
analyzed: de dag lus yongs su dag pa de dag gis skye po mang po dga' ba dang mos pa bskyed de /
translated: With those pure bodies they will generate joy and faith in many beings.

original: de dag 'gro ba mang po'i snying du sdug cing yid du 'ong ba dang / sems can de dag kyang sems mos par gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid kyis mthar gyis theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: de dag 'gro ba mang po'i snying du sdug cing yid du 'ong ba dang / sems can de dag kyang sems mos par gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de nyid kyis mthar gyis theg pa gsum gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: They will be dear and pleasing to many beings, and those beings, with that very root of merit of faith in mind, will eventually pass into complete nirvāṇa through the three vehicles.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: when great bodhisattva beings practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom in this manner,

original: lus yongs su dag pa dang / ngag yongs su dag pa dang / yid yongs su dag pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: lus yongs su dag pa dang / ngag yongs su dag pa dang / yid yongs su dag pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: they should train in the purity of body, the purity of speech, and the purity of mind.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa dag dbang po shin tu gsal ba thob nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa dag dbang po shin tu gsal ba thob nas /
translated: “Śāriputra, there are also bodhisattva great beings who, practicing the six perfections, attain the very clear faculties.

original: de dag dbang po shin tu gsal ba de dag gis bdag mi bstod cing gzhan mi smod pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: de dag dbang po shin tu gsal ba de dag gis bdag mi bstod cing gzhan mi smod pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: With those very clear faculties, they do not praise themselves or disparage others.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang po sems bskyed phyin chad /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang po sems bskyed phyin chad /
translated: there are also bodhisattva great beings who, from the first production of the thought of awakening onward,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /🔽phyir mi ldog pa'i sa ma thob kyi bar du nam yang dbul bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing / phyir mi ldog pa'i sa ma thob kyi bar du nam yang dbul bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: stand in the perfection of giving and the perfection of morality.🔽Until they attain the irreversible level, they are never poor,

original: log par 'go ba dang / ngan song du mi ltung ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: log par 'go ba dang / ngan song du mi ltung ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: and they do not fall into error or into the lower realms.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang po sems bskyed phyin chad /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dang po sems bskyed phyin chad /
translated: there are also bodhisattva great beings who, from the first production of the thought of awakening onward,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa ma @93a *//
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa ma @93a *//
translated: The stage of non-returning🔽

original: thob kyi bar du nam yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam mi gtong ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: thob kyi bar du nam yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam mi gtong ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: and who do not give up the path of the ten wholesome actions until they have attained the irreversible level.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: there are also bodhisattva great beings who, abiding in the perfections of generosity and discipline,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por gyur nas /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por gyur nas /
translated: become universal monarchs,

original: de dag dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams la sems can rab tu 'god pa dang / sbyin pa dang / ngag snyan pas sems can yongs su sdud pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: de dag dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams la sems can rab tu 'god pa dang / sbyin pa dang / ngag snyan pas sems can yongs su sdud pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: and who establish sentient beings in the path of the ten wholesome actions and attract sentient beings through generosity and pleasant speech.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāradvatī­putra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: there are also bodhisattva great beings who, abiding in the perfections of generosity and discipline,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid yongs su bzung ste /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid yongs su bzung ste /
translated: assume the status of a universal monarch,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid brgya stong du ma la gnas shing de la gnas nas sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma mnyes par byed de /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid brgya stong du ma la gnas shing de la gnas nas sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma mnyes par byed de /
translated: They will live for many hundreds of thousands of eons of world-dissolution and evolution, and during that time they will please many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of Buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la yo byad thams cad dang / mchod pa sna tshogs kyis rim gro dang bkur sti dang bsti stang dang mchod pa byed pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la yo byad thams cad dang / mchod pa sna tshogs kyis rim gro dang bkur sti dang bsti stang dang mchod pa byed pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: and they will serve and venerate those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, with all the requisites and with various kinds of worship.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
translated: there are also bodhisattva great beings who, abiding in the six perfections,

original: sems can log par lta ba'i mun pa can rnams la /
analyzed: sems can log par lta ba'i mun pa can rnams la /
translated: for the sake of sentient beings who are in the darkness of wrong views

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis snang bar byed cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis snang bar byed cing /
translated: illuminate the Dharma of the Buddha.

original: bdag nyid kyang nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs @93b ma rgyas kyi bar du /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang nam bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs @93b ma rgyas kyi bar du /
translated: And they themselves, until they fully and completely awaken to unsurpassed, perfect awakening,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos snang ba de'ang nam yang 'bral bar mi byed bdag kyang yod de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos snang ba de'ang nam yang 'bral bar mi byed bdag kyang yod de /
translated: He never abandons the light of the Buddha’s Dharma.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi chos la yang dag par byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sangs rgyas kyi chos la yang dag par byung ba yin no //
translated: this is the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s emergence into the Buddha’s Dharma.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: therefore, when bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnams kyi go mi dbye'o //🔽de skad ces bka' stsal ba dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus /🔽bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnams kyi go mi dbye'o // de skad ces bka' stsal ba dang / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bus / bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: they do not engage in physical, verbal, or mental actions that are accompanied by wrongdoing.🔽The Blessed One having said this,🔽the venerable Śāradvatīputra said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus kyi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / ngag gi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus kyi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / ngag gi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa gang lags /
translated: his verbal action that is reprehensible, and his mental action that is reprehensible?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di snyam du sems shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di snyam du sems shing /
translated: when a bodhisattva-mahāsattva thinks like this:

original: 'di ni lus yin gyi des ni lus kyi las shig brtsam /
analyzed: 'di ni lus yin gyi des ni lus kyi las shig brtsam /
translated: ‘This is the body, so with it one should undertake physical actions;

original: 'di ni ngag yin gyi des ni ngag gi las shig brtsam /
analyzed: 'di ni ngag yin gyi des ni ngag gi las shig brtsam /
translated: this is speech, so with it one should undertake verbal actions;

original: 'di ni yid yin gyi des ni yid kyi las shig brtsam snyam na /
analyzed: 'di ni yid yin gyi des ni yid kyi las shig brtsam snyam na /
translated: this is the mind, so with it one should undertake mental actions,’

original: de ni sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: de ni sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rtsom pa kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rtsom pa kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: that is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s undertaking of physical, verbal, and mental actions that is reprehensible.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ni /🔽lus gang dang ngag gang dang yid gang gis 'jungs @94a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas ni / lus gang dang ngag gang dang yid gang gis 'jungs @94a *//
translated: “Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom🔽do not apprehend a body, speech, or mind with which to give rise to a stingy

original: pa'i sems bskyed pa'am /🔽tshul khrims ngan pa'i sems bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: pa'i sems bskyed pa'am / tshul khrims ngan pa'i sems bskyed pa'am /
translated: thought,🔽to give rise to a thought of bad moral discipline,

original: gnod sems kyi sems bskyed pa'am /🔽le lo'i sems bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: gnod sems kyi sems bskyed pa'am / le lo'i sems bskyed pa'am /
translated: to give rise to a thought of ill will,🔽to give rise to a thought of laziness,

original: 'khrug pa'i sems bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: 'khrug pa'i sems bskyed pa'am /
translated: to give rise to a thought of distraction,🔽or to give rise to a thought of confused understanding.

original: shes rab 'chal pa'i sems bskyed par bya ba de lta bu'i lus mi dmigs so //
analyzed: shes rab 'chal pa'i sems bskyed par bya ba de lta bu'i lus mi dmigs so //
translated: They do not apprehend a body,

original: ngag mi dmigs so //
analyzed: ngag mi dmigs so //
translated: they do not apprehend a speech,

original: sems mi dmigs so //
analyzed: sems mi dmigs so //
translated: and they do not apprehend a mind.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings are practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi gnas ngan len skyed pa tsam du'ang shes par mi bya ste /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi gnas ngan len skyed pa tsam du'ang shes par mi bya ste /
translated: they should not even think, ‘I will give rise to the physical, verbal, or mental negative reflex actions.’

original: de ni gnas med do //
analyzed: de ni gnas med do //
translated: That is not possible.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: It is like this: when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ste /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ste /
translated: they purify the negative tendencies of body, speech, and mind.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
translated: this is the bodhisattva great beings’ untainted activity of body, speech, and mind.

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāradvatīputra then asked, “Blessed One,

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus kyi gnas ngan len sbyong ba dang / ngag gi gnas ngan len sbyong ba dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ba lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus kyi gnas ngan len sbyong ba dang / ngag gi gnas ngan len sbyong ba dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ba lags /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings purify the negative tendencies of body, speech, and mind?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Śāradvatīputra,

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus mi dmigs pa dang / ngag dang sems mi dmigs pa de'i tshe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus mi dmigs pa dang / ngag dang sems mi dmigs pa de'i tshe na /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings do not apprehend body, speech, or mind,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus dang @94b ngag dang yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus dang @94b ngag dang yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su sbyong ba yin no //
translated: Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas purify the negative tendencies of body, speech, and mind.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed phyin chad /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems dang po bskyed phyin chad /
translated: Furthermore, Śāradvatīputra, from the first production of the thought of awakening,

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yang dag par blangs te gnas shing /
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yang dag par blangs te gnas shing /
translated: bodhisattva-mahāsattvas take up and abide in the path of the ten virtuous actions,

original: nyan thos kyi sems sam rang sangs rgyas kyi sems bskyed pa mad par de rtag tu rgyun mi chad par sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po'i sems nye bar gzhog na /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sems sam rang sangs rgyas kyi sems bskyed pa mad par de rtag tu rgyun mi chad par sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po'i sems nye bar gzhog na /
translated: and without producing the thought of the śrāvakas or pratyekabuddhas, they constantly and always bring to mind great compassion for all sentient beings.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su dag pa zhes ngas bshad do //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi gnas ngan len yongs su dag pa zhes ngas bshad do //
translated: I explain that this is the purification of the negative tendencies of body, speech, and mind of bodhisattva-mahāsattvas.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong zhing /
translated: “Subhūti, there are bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom who are training in the path to awakening,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: practicing the perfection of generosity, the perfection of conduct, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: and the perfection of wisdom.”🔽Subhūti asked,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam gang lags /
translated: what is the bodhisattva great beings’ path to awakening?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: nam lus la dmigs pa med pa dang / ngag dang / yid la dmigs pa med pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa med pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin @95a *//
analyzed: nam lus la dmigs pa med pa dang / ngag dang / yid la dmigs pa med pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa med pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin @95a *//
translated: no reference point for speech, no reference point for mind, no reference point for the perfection of generosity,

original: pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa med pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa la dmigs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa med pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa la dmigs pa med pa dang /
translated: no reference point for the perfection of discipline, no reference point for the perfection of patience, no reference point for the perfection of diligence, no reference point for the perfection of concentration, no reference point for the perfection of insight, no reference point for the vehicle of the hearers,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la dmigs pa med pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la dmigs pa med par gyur pa de ni /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la dmigs pa med pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la dmigs pa med par gyur pa de ni /
translated: no reference point for the vehicle of the solitary buddhas, and no reference point for the vehicle of the bodhisattvas and the vehicle of the perfect buddhas,

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam yin te /
translated: this is the bodhisattva great beings’ path to awakening.

original: de ltar chos thams cad la dmigs pa med cing /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad la dmigs pa med cing /
translated: In this way, all phenomena are without reference point,

original: blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa'o //
analyzed: blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa'o //
translated: without acceptance, and without rejection.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lam de lta bus pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing nan tan du byed pa de dag ni sus kyang thub pa med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lam de lta bus pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing nan tan du byed pa de dag ni sus kyang thub pa med do //
translated: those bodhisattva great beings who practice the six perfections and are diligent on this path cannot be defeated by anyone.🔽Śāradvatīputra asked,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul ji lta bur spyod pa rnams thub pa ma mchis pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul ji lta bur spyod pa rnams thub pa ma mchis pa lags /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings practice so that they cannot be defeated?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: nam byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: “When bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: gzugs la rlom sems med pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la rlom sems med pa dang / mig dang gzugs la rlom sems med pa dang / rna ba dang sgra dang / sna dang dri dang /
analyzed: gzugs la rlom sems med pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa la rlom sems med pa dang / mig dang gzugs la rlom sems med pa dang / rna ba dang sgra dang / sna dang dri dang /
translated: It is to be without concepts of form, and to be without concepts of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness. It is to be without concepts of the eyes and form, and to be without concepts of the ears and sounds, the nose and smells,

original: @95b lce dang ro dang / lus dang reg bya dang / yid dang chos la rlom sems med pa dang / sa'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang /
analyzed: @95b lce dang ro dang / lus dang reg bya dang / yid dang chos la rlom sems med pa dang / sa'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang /
translated: the tongue and tastes, the body and textures, and the mind and mental phenomena. It is to be without concepts of the earth element, and to be without concepts of the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element,🔽and the consciousness element. It is to be without concepts of the eye constituent, and to be without concepts of the form constituent and the eye consciousness constituent, and to be without concepts of the ear constituent, the sound constituent,

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / mig gi khams la rlom sems med pa dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / rna ba'i khams dang / sgra'i khams dang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / mig gi khams la rlom sems med pa dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / rna ba'i khams dang / sgra'i khams dang /
translated: and the ear consciousness constituent, and to be without concepts of the nose constituent, the smell constituent,🔽and the nose consciousness constituent, and to be without concepts of the tongue constituent, the taste constituent,🔽and the tongue consciousness constituent, and to be without concepts of the body constituent, the texture constituent,🔽and the body consciousness constituent, and to be without concepts of the mind constituent, the mental phenomena constituent,🔽and the mind consciousness constituent.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / sna'i khams dang / dri'i khams dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lce'i khams dang / ro'i khams dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams dang /
translated: the ear element, the nose element, the smell element, the nose consciousness element, the tongue element, the taste element, the tongue consciousness element, the body element, the tangible-object element,

original: lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams la rlom sems med pa dang / chos kyi khams la rlom sems med pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la rlom sems med pa dang /
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang / yid kyi khams la rlom sems med pa dang / chos kyi khams la rlom sems med pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams la rlom sems med pa dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la rlom sems med pa dang /
translated: the body consciousness element, the mental element, the dharma element, the mental consciousness element, dependent origination,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rlom sems med pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rlom sems med pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: the perfection of generosity, the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rlom sems med pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la rlom sems med pa dang / dran pa nye @96a *//🔽bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la rlom sems med pa dang /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rlom sems med pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la rlom sems med pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la rlom sems med pa dang / dran pa nye @96a *// bar bzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa la rlom sems med pa dang /
translated: It is to be without mental constructs with regard to the perfection of wisdom. It is to be without mental constructs with regard to inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature. It is to be without mental constructs with regard to the four applications of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four foundations of miraculous abilities, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven aspects of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la rlom sems med pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi la rlom sems med pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la rlom sems med pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la rlom sems med pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi la rlom sems med pa dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la rlom sems med pa dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang /
translated: It is to be without mental constructs with regard to the four noble truths, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, and the four formless absorptions. It is to be without mental constructs with regard to the eight aspects of liberation, the nine serial steps of meditative absorption, and the eight aspects of the noble path.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la rlom sems med pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la rlom sems med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la rlom sems med pa dang /
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la rlom sems med pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la rlom sems med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams la rlom sems med pa dang /
translated: emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness, and the superknowledges.

original: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la rlom sems med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la rlom sems med pa dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams la rlom sems med pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la rlom sems med pa dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang /
translated: “It is to be without concepts regarding the meditative stabilities, dhāraṇī gateways, ten powers of the tathāgatas, four assurances, four kinds of exact knowledge, great love,🔽great compassion, and eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.
