original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: there are also some bodhisattva great beings who, when they practice the perfection of wisdom,🔽take up the mind that is not confused because of the emptiness that transcends extremes, and train in the path to the knowledge of all aspects.🔽“Subhūti,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gnas shing /
translated: there are also some bodhisattva great beings who, when

original: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because of the emptiness of the unlimited,

original: 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa nye bar bzung ba dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med pa nye bar bzung bas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba yin no //🔽de la sbyin pa ni yongs su @109a *//
analyzed: 'ong ba med pa dang / 'gro ba med pa nye bar bzung ba dang / yongs su 'dzin pa med pa nye bar bzung bas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam yongs su sbyong ba yin no // de la sbyin pa ni yongs su @109a *//
translated: he purifies the path to the knowledge of all modes by taking up the non-coming and non-going, and by taking up the non-grasping.

original: 'dzin pa nye bar bzung ba las gdags so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa nye bar bzung ba las gdags so //
translated: Therein, giving is imputed on the basis of grasping at possessions.

original: tshul khrims ni tshul khrims ngan pa nye bar bzung ba las gdags so //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni tshul khrims ngan pa nye bar bzung ba las gdags so //
translated: Morality is imputed on the basis of grasping at immorality.🔽Patience is imputed on the basis of grasping at anger.

original: bzod ba ni 'khrug pa nye bar bzung ba las gdags so; ;brtson 'grus ni le lo nye bar bzung ba las gdags so //
analyzed: bzod ba ni 'khrug pa nye bar bzung ba las gdags so; ;brtson 'grus ni le lo nye bar bzung ba las gdags so //
translated: Exertion is imputed on the basis of grasping at laziness.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa nye bar bzung ba las gdags so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa nye bar bzung ba las gdags so //
translated: Concentration is imputed on the basis of grasping at the uncollected mind.

original: shes rab ni shes rab 'chal pa nye bar bzung ba las gdags so //🔽de ni rgal to zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: shes rab ni shes rab 'chal pa nye bar bzung ba las gdags so // de ni rgal to zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: Wisdom is imputed on the basis of grasping at stupidity.🔽He does not think, “I have crossed over.”

original: ma rgal to zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: ma rgal to zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not think, “I have not crossed over.”

original: sbyin pa byed do zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: sbyin pa byed do zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not imagine that he is giving.

original: sbyin pa mi byed do zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //🔽tshul khrims dang ldan no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: sbyin pa mi byed do zhes bya bar rlom sems med do // tshul khrims dang ldan no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not imagine that he is not giving.🔽He does not imagine that he is moral.

original: tshul khrims ngan pa can no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: tshul khrims ngan pa can no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not imagine that he is immoral.

original: bzod pa phun sum tshogs so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: bzod pa phun sum tshogs so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not imagine that he is patient.

original: khro ba can no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: khro ba can no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not imagine that he is angry.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa'o zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa'o zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not imagine that he is energetic.

original: le lo can no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //🔽mnyam par bzhag pa'o zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: le lo can no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do // mnyam par bzhag pa'o zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not imagine that he is lazy.🔽He does not imagine that he is concentrated.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'o zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //🔽shes rab dang ldan no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'o zhes bya bar rlom sems med do // shes rab dang ldan no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not imagine that he is distracted.🔽He does not imagine that he is wise.

original: shes rab 'chal pa can no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: shes rab 'chal pa can no zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not imagine that he is unwise.

original: spyos so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: spyos so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: He does not imagine that he is reviling.

original: phyag byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: phyag byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: they do not falsely project, ‘I have made prostrations.’

original: rim gro byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med @109b do; ;rim gro ma byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: rim gro byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med @109b do; ;rim gro ma byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: They do not falsely project, ‘I have made offerings.’ They do not falsely project, ‘I have not made offerings.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: ma skyes pa ni spyos so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //🔽phyag byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni spyos so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do // phyag byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: they do not falsely project, ‘I have made prostrations to the unborn.’🔽They do not falsely project, ‘I have made prostrations.’

original: rim gro byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: rim gro byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: They do not falsely project, ‘I have made offerings.’

original: rim gro ma byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
analyzed: rim gro ma byas so zhes bya bar rlom sems med do //
translated: They do not falsely project, ‘I have not made offerings.’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rlom sems thams cad yang dag par gcod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni rlom sems thams cad yang dag par gcod pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is because this perfection of wisdom completely severs all false projections.

original: 'di la / sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: 'di la / sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatī­putra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: yon tan ji snyed cig yod pa de dag ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad la med de /
analyzed: yon tan ji snyed cig yod pa de dag ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad la med de /
translated: All those qualities do not exist in all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de yon tan 'di dag yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de yon tan 'di dag yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i tshe /
translated: When he perfects those qualities,

original: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed /
translated: he also brings beings to maturity,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed /
translated: he also purifies his buddhafield,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang thob par byed do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang thob par byed do //
translated: and he also attains the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: further, when bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: sems can thams cad la snyoms pa'i sems bskyed de /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la snyoms pa'i sems bskyed de /
translated: they give rise to an attitude of equality toward all beings.

original: sems can thams cad la mnyam pa'i sems bskyed nas chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid rab tu 'thob bo //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la mnyam pa'i sems bskyed nas chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid rab tu 'thob bo //
translated: Having given rise to an attitude of equality toward all beings, they attain the equality of all dharmas.

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid rab tu thob nas /
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid rab tu thob nas /
translated: Having attained the equality of all dharmas,

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la sems can thams cad rab tu 'god do //
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la sems can thams cad rab tu 'god do //
translated: they establish all beings in the equality of all dharmas.

original: de ni tshe 'di nyid la'ang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs su byon cing dben par bya ba yin @110a *//
analyzed: de ni tshe 'di nyid la'ang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi thugs su byon cing dben par bya ba yin @110a *//
translated: In this very life, they are pleasing and secluded to the blessed buddhas,

original: te; byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / nyan thos thams cad dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang yid du 'ong zhing dben par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: te; byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang / nyan thos thams cad dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang yid du 'ong zhing dben par bya ba yin no //
translated: and they are pleasing and secluded to all bodhisattvas, all śrāvakas, and all pratyekabuddhas.

original: de ni skye ba gang dang gang du skyes kyang /
analyzed: de ni skye ba gang dang gang du skyes kyang /
translated: Wherever they are born,

original: de dang de dag tu nam yang mig gis yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de dang de dag tu nam yang mig gis yid du mi 'ong ba'i gzugs mi mthong ngo //
translated: there they will never see with their eyes any form that is unappealing.

original: rna bas yid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra mi thos so //🔽snas yid du mi 'ong ba'i dri mi tshor ro //
analyzed: rna bas yid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra mi thos so // snas yid du mi 'ong ba'i dri mi tshor ro //
translated: They will never hear with their ears any sound that is unappealing.🔽They will never smell with their noses any smell that is unappealing.

original: lces yid du mi 'ong ba'i ro mi myong ngo //
analyzed: lces yid du mi 'ong ba'i ro mi myong ngo //
translated: They will never taste with their tongues any taste that is unappealing.

original: lus kyis yid du mi 'ong ba'i reg bya mi reg go /
analyzed: lus kyis yid du mi 'ong ba'i reg bya mi reg go /
translated: They will never touch with their bodies any texture that is unappealing.

original: yid kyis yid du mi 'ong ba'i chos rnam par rig pa med do //
analyzed: yid kyis yid du mi 'ong ba'i chos rnam par rig pa med do //
translated: They will never cognize with their minds any phenomenon that is unappealing.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la de ltar spyod pa ni /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom in this way

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: will not regress from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di bstan pa'i tshe /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di bstan pa'i tshe /
translated: When this teaching of the perfection of wisdom was taught,🔽three hundred monks

original: dge slong sum brgyas gos gyon gyon pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das la yon du gsol te /
analyzed: dge slong sum brgyas gos gyon gyon pa / bcom ldan 'das la yon du gsol te /
translated: offered their robes

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: to the Blessed One and gave rise to the mind set on unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe /
translated: Then the Blessed One,

original: dge slong rnams kyi bsam pa mkhyen nas zhal 'dzum pa mdzad do //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyi bsam pa mkhyen nas zhal 'dzum pa mdzad do //
translated: knowing the thoughts of the monks, smiled.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan de las langs te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan de las langs te /
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda rose from his seat,

original: bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas /
analyzed: bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas /
translated: put his upper robe over one shoulder,

original: pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
analyzed: pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
translated: put his right knee on the ground,🔽bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined,🔽and said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das gang na bde logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na bde logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de /
translated: “Blessed One, what is the cause, what is the reason for smiling?

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He addressed the Blessed One, saying:

original: bcom @110b ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen ma mchis par bzhad pa mi mdzad na /
analyzed: bcom @110b ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen ma mchis par bzhad pa mi mdzad na /
translated: “Blessed One, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas do not smile without cause or condition.

original: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis zhal 'dzum pa mdzad /
analyzed: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis zhal 'dzum pa mdzad /
translated: What is the cause and what is the condition for your smile?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One replied to the venerable Ānanda:

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: dge slong sum brgya po 'di dag ni bskal pa drug cu rtsa gcig 'das nas /
analyzed: dge slong sum brgya po 'di dag ni bskal pa drug cu rtsa gcig 'das nas /
translated: after one hundred and sixty-one eons have passed,

original: bskal pa dpe skar ma lta bu la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dpal chen po zhes bya ba sha stag 'jig rten du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bskal pa dpe skar ma lta bu la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dpal chen po zhes bya ba sha stag 'jig rten du 'byung ngo //
translated: in the eon called Star-like, these three hundred monks will appear in the world as thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas all named Great Glory.

original: 'di dag ni 'di nas shi 'phos nas /
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'di nas shi 'phos nas /
translated: After they die and pass on from here,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi sgul ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skye'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi sgul ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skye'o //
translated: they will be reborn in the buddhafield of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Akṣobhya.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu stong phrag drug cus kyang /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu stong phrag drug cus kyang /
translated: And six hundred thousand sons of gods who live in the desire realm

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de /
translated: have given rise to the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas byams pa mnyes par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas byams pa mnyes par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will please the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One Maitreya.

original: de nyid du rab tu byung nas tshangs par spyad pa spyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid du rab tu byung nas tshangs par spyad pa spyod par 'gyur te /
translated: They will go forth in his presence and practice pure conduct.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byams pa des kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byams pa des kyang /
translated: The Tathāgata Maitreya

original: de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: will prophesy their unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mthus /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis mthus /
translated: Then, by the power of the Blessed One,

original: de'i tshe 'khor bzhi po de dag 'di na 'khod bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'khor bzhi po de dag 'di na 'khod bzhin du /
translated: the fourfold assembly, while remaining in this very place,

original: shar phyogs kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing stong mthong bar gyur to //🔽lho dang nub dang byang dang / byang shar dang shar lho dang lho nub @111a *//
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing stong mthong bar gyur to // lho dang nub dang byang dang / byang shar dang shar lho dang lho nub @111a *//
translated: He saw a thousand buddha-fields in the eastern direction.

original: dang nub byang dang / 'og dang steng gi phyogs kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing stong mthong bar gyur to //🔽'jig rten gyi khams de dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par bye ba gang ji lta bur mthong ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba de dag kyang /
analyzed: dang nub byang dang / 'og dang steng gi phyogs kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing stong mthong bar gyur to // 'jig rten gyi khams de dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par bye ba gang ji lta bur mthong ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan rnam par phye ba de dag kyang /
translated: He saw a thousand buddha-fields in the southern, western, and northern directions, in the intermediate directions, and in the nadir and the zenith.🔽He saw the splendor of the buddha-fields of the blessed buddhas in those world systems.

original: mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na yod par ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na yod par ma mthong ngo //
translated: But he did not see the splendor of the buddha-field in this Sahā world system.

original: de nas 'khor de'i nang nas srog chags stong phrag bcus bdag cag gis las gang byas pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i las spyad par bya'o zhes smon lam btab bo //
analyzed: de nas 'khor de'i nang nas srog chags stong phrag bcus bdag cag gis las gang byas pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu skye bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i las spyad par bya'o zhes smon lam btab bo //
translated: Then ten thousand living beings in the assembly made a vow, saying, “We will practice the deeds that will enable us to be born in those buddha-lands.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs kyi bu de dag gi bsam pa thugs su chud nas zhal 'dzum pa mdzad do //🔽de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan las langs te /🔽bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs kyi bu de dag gi bsam pa thugs su chud nas zhal 'dzum pa mdzad do // de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan las langs te / bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas /
translated: Then the World-Honored One, knowing the thoughts of these sons of Buddha, smiled.

original: pus mo g-yas pa'i lha pas la btsugs te /🔽bcom ldan 'das gang na ba de logs su thal mo sbyar bas btud de /
analyzed: pus mo g-yas pa'i lha pas la btsugs te / bcom ldan 'das gang na ba de logs su thal mo sbyar bas btud de /
translated: At that time the Venerable Ananda rose from his seat, bared his right shoulder, knelt on his right knee,

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: put his palms together respectfully, and said to the Buddha:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “World-Honored One,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen ma mchis par bzhad pa mi mdzad na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen ma mchis par bzhad pa mi mdzad na /
translated: the buddhas, the world-honored ones, do not smile without reason.

original: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis zhal 'dzum pa mdzad /
analyzed: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis zhal 'dzum pa mdzad /
translated: What is the reason, what is the cause, for your smile?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: srog chags stong phrag bcu po 'di dag mthong ngam /
analyzed: srog chags stong phrag bcu po 'di dag mthong ngam /
translated: do you see these ten thousand living beings?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //
translated: “Yes, Blessed One, I see them.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: @111b kun dga' bo /
analyzed: @111b kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: srog chags stong phrag bcu po 'di dag ni 'di nas shi 'phos nas /
analyzed: srog chags stong phrag bcu po 'di dag ni 'di nas shi 'phos nas /
translated: after these ten thousand living beings die,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they will be reborn in those buddhafields.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang yang nam du'ang mi 'bral te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams dang yang nam du'ang mi 'bral te /
translated: They will never be separated from the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly awakened ones.

original: phyi ma'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rgyan gyi rgyal po zhes bya ba sha stag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi ma'i dus na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rgyan gyi rgyal po zhes bya ba sha stag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the future, they will appear in the world as tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened ones, all named Aḍakṣiṇīya.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu dang / tshe dang ldan pa moo'u 'gal chen po'i bu dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor dang / tshe dang ldan pa shes pa'i bu gang po dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po dang /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu dang / tshe dang ldan pa moo'u 'gal chen po'i bu dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor dang / tshe dang ldan pa shes pa'i bu gang po dang / tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po dang /
translated: Then the Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, the Venerable Subhūti, the Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra, the Venerable Mahākāśyapa,

original: dge slong gzhan dag kyang kun gyis mngon par shes pa shin tu mang ba dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shin tu mang ba dag dang / dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma shin tu mang ba dag gis /
analyzed: dge slong gzhan dag kyang kun gyis mngon par shes pa shin tu mang ba dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shin tu mang ba dag dang / dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma shin tu mang ba dag gis /
translated: and many other monks who had attained the higher knowledges, many bodhisattva mahāsattvas, many monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen,

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: addressed the Blessed One as follows:

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / 'di lta ste /
translated: Blessed One,🔽this perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen po'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chen po'o //
translated: is the great perfection of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: this perfection of wisdom

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yangs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yangs pa'o //
translated: This perfection of wisdom is the spacious perfection of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni dam pa'o //🔽pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni rab bo //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni dam pa'o // pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni rab bo //
translated: This perfection is the highest.🔽This perfection is the best.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni phul lo //🔽@112a *// pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni mchog go /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni phul lo // @112a *// pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni mchog go /
translated: This perfection is the most excellent.🔽This perfection is the sublime.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni gya nom pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni gya nom pa'o //
translated: This perfection is the most refined.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bzang po'o //🔽pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bla na ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bzang po'o // pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni bla na ma mchis pa'o //
translated: This perfection is the good.🔽This perfection is unsurpassed.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ltag na ma mchis pa'o //🔽pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni mnyam pa ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni ltag na ma mchis pa'o // pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni mnyam pa ma mchis pa'o //
translated: This perfection is unequaled.🔽This perfection is incomparable.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o //🔽pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni 'dra ba ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'o // pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni 'dra ba ma mchis pa'o //
translated: This perfection is unmatched.🔽This perfection is without equal.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni mtshungs pa ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni mtshungs pa ma mchis pa'o //
translated: This perfection is without compare.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni nam mkha'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni nam mkha'o //
translated: This perfection is space.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is the emptiness of defining characteristics.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid do //
translated: this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni dngos po ma mchis pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: this perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is the perfection of all good qualities.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This perfection of the bodhisattva great beings is endowed with all good qualities.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu @112b phyin pa thub pa ma mchis pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi pha rol tu @112b phyin pa thub pa ma mchis pa'o //
translated: This perfection of wisdom is the invincible perfection of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ni /
translated: the bodhisattva great beings who practice this perfection of wisdom

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sbyin pa yongs su btang ngo //🔽yongs su gtong ngo //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sbyin pa yongs su btang ngo // yongs su gtong ngo //
translated: have given the gift of what is equal to the unequalled.🔽They give.

original: yongs su gtong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su gtong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will give.

original: de'i slad du mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur to //🔽yongs su rdzogs so //
analyzed: de'i slad du mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur to // yongs su rdzogs so //
translated: Therefore, the perfection of giving that is equal to the unequalled is complete,🔽was complete,

original: yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: will be complete.

original: de'i slad du mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i lus thob par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i slad du mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i lus thob par gyur to //
translated: Therefore, they have attained a body that is equal to the unequaled.

original: thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will attain it.

original: de'i slad du mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i chos 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i slad du mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i chos 'di lta ste /
translated: Therefore, they have attained the Dharma that is equal to the unequaled, namely,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par gyur to //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par gyur to //
translated: the highest, complete enlightenment.

original: thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will attain it.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ni /
translated: the bodhisattva great beings who practice this perfection of wisdom

original: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i tshul khrims bsrungs so //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i tshul khrims bsrungs so //
translated: have guarded the unequaled morality.

original: bsrung ngo // srung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsrung ngo // srung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will guard it.

original: de'i slad du mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur to //🔽yongs su rdzogs so //
analyzed: de'i slad du mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur to // yongs su rdzogs so //
translated: Therefore, they have perfected the perfection of morality that is equal to the unequaled.🔽They have perfected it.

original: yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will perfect it.

original: de'i slad du mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i lus thob par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i slad du mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i lus thob par gyur to //
translated: Therefore, they have attained a body that is equal to the unequaled.

original: thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro //🔽de'i slad du mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i chos 'di lta ste /
analyzed: thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro // de'i slad du mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i chos 'di lta ste /
translated: have attained, will attain,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur to //🔽thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro //🔽bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub @113a *//
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur to // thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro // bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub @113a *//
translated: and are attaining the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, which is a Dharma that is equal to the unequalled.

original: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ni /🔽mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i bzod pa bsgoms so //
analyzed: sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ni / mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i bzod pa bsgoms so //
translated: “Blessed One, the bodhisattva great beings who practice this perfection of wisdom

original: sgom mo // bsgom par 'gyur ro //🔽de'i slad du mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur to //🔽yongs su rdzogs so //
analyzed: sgom mo // bsgom par 'gyur ro // de'i slad du mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur to // yongs su rdzogs so //
translated: have cultivated, are cultivating, and will cultivate the acceptance that is equal to the unequalled.

original: yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //🔽de'i slad du mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i lus thob par gyur to //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro // de'i slad du mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i lus thob par gyur to //
translated: Therefore, they have perfected, are perfecting, and will perfect the perfection of acceptance that is equal to the unequalled.

original: thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they have attained, are attaining, and will attain bodies that are equal to the unequalled.

original: de'i slad du mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i chos 'di lta ste /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i slad du mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i chos 'di lta ste / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par gyur to //
translated: Therefore, he has attained the unequalled Dharma,🔽namely, unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.🔽

original: thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they have attained, are attaining, and will attain the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, which is a Dharma that is equal to the unequaled.

original: bcom ldan 'das shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis ni mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i brtson 'grus brtsams so //

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par gyur to //

original: bcom ldan 'das /

original: thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro //

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: yongs su rdzogs so //

analyzed: thob bo; ;'thob par 'gyur ro //

original: thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro //

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la spyad pas mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i gzugs brnyes par gyur to // mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i tshor ba dang / @114a *//

analyzed: mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa'i gzugs brnyes par gyur to //

analyzed: de dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pas /

analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thams cad 'thob bo //
translated: they attain all mundane and supramundane perfections.

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: “Noble sons,

analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i don du zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva mahāsattva is engaged in the welfare and happiness of all sentient beings.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe zhal gyi sgo nas ljags kyi dbang po bkram ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe zhal gyi sgo nas ljags kyi dbang po bkram ste /
translated: Then the Blessed One, at that time, extended his tongue and

analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di khyab par mdzad do //
translated: covered this trichiliocosm with it.

original: de nas de'i tshe ljags kyi dbang po de las 'od 'phro ba kha dog du ma dang / kha dog sna tshogs su ldan pa mang po byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe ljags kyi dbang po de las 'od 'phro ba kha dog du ma dang / kha dog sna tshogs su ldan pa mang po byung bar gyur to //
translated: Then at that time, from that tongue, many lights of various colors and various arrays issued forth.

original: de byung nas shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang pa chen pos rgyas par gyur to //
analyzed: de byung nas shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang pa chen pos rgyas par gyur to //
translated: Having issued forth, they illuminated the world systems in the eastern direction as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River with a great light.

original: lho dang nub dang byang dang / byang shar dang shar lho dang lho nub dang nub byang dang / 'og dang steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing /
analyzed: lho dang nub dang byang dang / byang shar dang shar lho dang lho nub dang nub byang dang / 'og dang steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re re zhing /

analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed snang ba chen pos rgyas par gyur to //
translated: and the worlds in the ten directions, as many as the sands of the Ganges, were filled with a great light.

analyzed: de nas shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed po de dag gi byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag @116a *//

original: gis 'od rnam par phye ba de mthong nas /
analyzed: gis 'od rnam par phye ba de mthong nas /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams 'di dag snang ba chen pos gtams pa 'di lta bu su'i mthu lags /

analyzed: zhes yongs su dris so //

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /

analyzed: 'di nas nub phyogs logs na 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ces bya ba yod de /

analyzed: de na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba bzhugs te /

original: des zhal gyi sgo nas ljags kyi dbang po bkram ste /
analyzed: des zhal gyi sgo nas ljags kyi dbang po bkram ste /
translated: He has extended his tongue and

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'i phyir /

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the perfection of wisdom to the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas,

analyzed: phyogs bcu'i phyogs re re'i bar du 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed po 'di dag snang ba chen pos khyab bar mdzad do //

analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then those bodhisattva great beings said to those buddha bhagavāns:

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de lta lags na bdag cag kyang /

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom @116b pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa de blta ba dang de la phyag bgyi ba dang bsnyen bkur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyogs bcu nas 'dus pa de dag kyang blta ba dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom @116b pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa de blta ba dang de la phyag bgyi ba dang bsnyen bkur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po phyogs bcu nas 'dus pa de dag kyang blta ba dang /
translated: and we wish to see those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have gathered from the ten directions,

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de'ang mnyan pa'i slad du mchi'o //

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Those buddha bhagavāns said,

original: rigs kyi bu dag /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag /
translated: “Noble sons,

original: de'i dus la bab par shes na deng zhig /
analyzed: de'i dus la bab par shes na deng zhig /
translated: if you know that the time has come, then go!”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag gis /
translated: Then those bodhisattva mahāsattvas

original: lan bdun du g-yas phyogs nas bskor ba byas te /🔽phyogs bcu nas gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / lha'i ba dan dang / me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / bdug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gser gyi me tog dang / dngul gyi me tog la sogs pa rnam pa du ma khyer te /
analyzed: lan bdun du g-yas phyogs nas bskor ba byas te / phyogs bcu nas gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / lha'i ba dan dang / me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / bdug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gser gyi me tog dang / dngul gyi me tog la sogs pa rnam pa du ma khyer te /
translated: circumambulated them clockwise seven times,

original: glu dang rol mo brdung ba dang dkrol ba mang pos /
analyzed: glu dang rol mo brdung ba dang dkrol ba mang pos /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa de gang na ba der 'dong ngo //
translated: they went to the place where the Blessed One, the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha Śākyamuni was.

original: de nas rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum dang / mtshe ma dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs ris dang / tshangs lha nye phan dang / tshangs pa kun 'khor dang /
analyzed: de nas rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum dang / mtshe ma dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs ris dang / tshangs lha nye phan dang / tshangs pa kun 'khor dang /
translated: Then the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings, the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the Yāma Heaven, the Tuṣita Heaven, the Nirmāṇarati Heaven, the Paranirmitavaśavartin Heaven, the Brahmakāyika Heaven, the Brahmapurohita Heaven, the Brahmapārṣadya Heaven,

original: tshangs chen dang / snang ba dang / @117a *//
analyzed: tshangs chen dang / snang ba dang / @117a *//
translated: the Mahābrahmā Heaven, the Ābhāsvara Heaven,

original: chung snang dang / tshad med snang ba dang / kun snang dang ba dang / dge ba dang / chung dge dang / tshad med dge ba dang / dge rgyas dang / che ba dang / chung che dang / tshad med che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang /
analyzed: chung snang dang / tshad med snang ba dang / kun snang dang ba dang / dge ba dang / chung dge dang / tshad med dge ba dang / dge rgyas dang / che ba dang / chung che dang / tshad med che ba dang / 'bras bu che ba dang /

original: gnas gtsang ma ba shin tu mthong ba dang / gya nom snang ba dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyang lha rdzas kyi me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang /
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma ba shin tu mthong ba dang / gya nom snang ba dang / mi che ba dang / mi gdung ba dang / 'og min gyi lha rnams kyang lha rdzas kyi me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang /
translated: and the Śuddhāvāsa gods—the Sudarśana gods, the Sudṛśa gods, the Atapas, the Atapa, and the Akaniṣṭha gods—also brought divine flowers, garlands, incense, ointments,

original: bdug pa dang / phye ma dang / lha rdzas kyi me tog autpal dang / padmo dang / ku mu da dang / punda ri ka dang / lha rdzas kyi me tog mand'a ra ba dang / mand'a ra ba chen po dang / ke sa ra dang /
analyzed: bdug pa dang / phye ma dang / lha rdzas kyi me tog autpal dang / padmo dang / ku mu da dang / punda ri ka dang / lha rdzas kyi me tog mand'a ra ba dang / mand'a ra ba chen po dang / ke sa ra dang /
translated: incense, powders, divine utpala, lotus, kumuda, and pundarika flowers, divine mandara and great mandara flowers, and keśara flowers.

original: ta ma la'i lo ma mang po khyer te /
analyzed: ta ma la'i lo ma mang po khyer te /
translated: incense, powders, divine blue lotuses, red lotuses, night lotuses, white lotuses, and mandārava and great mandārava flowers, and many tāmalipta leaves,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa gang na ba der dong ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa gang na ba der dong ste /
translated: and went to the place where the Blessed One, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect Buddha Śākyamuni was residing.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / lha de dag gis me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / bdug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / lha de dag gis me tog dang / phreng ba dang / spos dang / byug pa dang / bdug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang /
translated: Then the bodhisattva great beings and the gods offered the flowers, garlands, incense, ointments, perfumes, powders, clothes, parasols, victory banners,

original: lha'i ba dan de dag gis /
analyzed: lha'i ba dan de dag gis /
translated: and divine flags

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa de la gtor to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa de la gtor to //
translated: They scattered them over the Bhagavat, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Shakyamuni.

original: mngon par gtor to //
analyzed: mngon par gtor to //
translated: They scattered them over him.

original: de nas me tog la sogs pa de dag stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i steng gi nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags te /
analyzed: de nas me tog la sogs pa de dag stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i steng gi nam mkha' la mngon par 'phags te /
translated: Then those flowers and so forth rose up into the sky above this billion-world-galactic universe,

original: @117b me tog gi khang pa brtsegs pa /
analyzed: @117b me tog gi khang pa brtsegs pa /
translated: and they formed a flower pavilion

original: gru bzhi ka ba bzhi dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gru bzhi ka ba bzhi dang ldan pa /
translated: with four corners and four pillars,

original: cha kun tu mnyam pa /
analyzed: cha kun tu mnyam pa /
translated: evenly proportioned,

original: shin tu rnam par phye ba /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par phye ba /
translated: very well divided,

original: mdangs dga' zhing yid du 'ong bar red de 'dug go /
analyzed: mdangs dga' zhing yid du 'ong bar red de 'dug go /
translated: and delightful and pleasing to the mind.

original: de nas 'khor de'i nang nas srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa rab tu thob bo //
analyzed: de nas 'khor de'i nang nas srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa rab tu thob bo //
translated: Then many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of kotis of living beings in that assembly attained the patient acceptance of the fact that dharmas do not arise.

original: de nas de dag stan las langs nas /
analyzed: de nas de dag stan las langs nas /
translated: Then they rose from their seats

original: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der thal mo sbyar bas btud de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der thal mo sbyar bas btud de /
translated: and bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined.

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: They said this to the Blessed One:🔽“Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: bdag cag kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na /
analyzed: bdag cag kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na /
translated: in the future,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gang brnyes par gyur pa'i chos kyi rnam pa de lta bu thams cad thob par gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis gang brnyes par gyur pa'i chos kyi rnam pa de lta bu thams cad thob par gyur te /
translated: we will attain all the aspects of the Dharma that the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One has attained.

original: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun 'di lta bu ni yongs su bsdu bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun 'di lta bu ni yongs su bsdu bar bgyi'o //
translated: We will gather a saṅgha of śrāvakas just like this.

original: da ltar 'dir de bzhin gshegs pas chos ji ltar bstan pa de bzhin du 'khor 'di dang 'dra bar chos bstan par bgyi'o zhes smon lam btab bo //
analyzed: da ltar 'dir de bzhin gshegs pas chos ji ltar bstan pa de bzhin du 'khor 'di dang 'dra bar chos bstan par bgyi'o zhes smon lam btab bo //
translated: Just as the Tathāgata teaches the Dharma here now, we will teach the Dharma to an assembly just like this one.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs kyi bu de dag gi bsam pa thugs su chud de /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis rigs kyi bu de dag gi bsam pa thugs su chud de /
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the thoughts of those sons of noble family,

original: chos thams cad la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa la bzod par gyur pa mkhyen nas zhal 'dzum pa mdzad do //
analyzed: chos thams cad la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa la bzod par gyur pa mkhyen nas zhal 'dzum pa mdzad do //
translated: knew that they had attained acceptance of the non-arising of all phenomena, the non-arising of all phenomena, the absence of mental activity, and the absence of origination, and he smiled.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan las langs te /🔽bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo stan las langs te / bla gos phrag pa gcig la gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda rose from his seat,🔽put his upper robe over one shoulder, and knelt on his right knee.

original: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der thal mo sbyar bas btud de /🔽bcom ldan @118a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der thal mo sbyar bas btud de / bcom ldan @118a *//
translated: With palms placed together he bowed to the Blessed One

original: 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen ma mchis par bzhad pa mi mdzad na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen ma mchis par bzhad pa mi mdzad na /
translated: since the blessed buddhas do not smile without a cause or condition,

original: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis zhal 'dzum pa mdzad /
analyzed: ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis zhal 'dzum pa mdzad /
translated: what is the cause and what is the condition for your smile?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

original: 'khor 'di'i nang nas srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: 'khor 'di'i nang nas srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gis mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
translated: in this assembly, hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of beings have attained acceptance of the fact that phenomena are not produced.

original: de dag ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig phrag drug cu rtsa brgyad na bskal pa me tog gi 'byung gnas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus na bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig phrag drug cu rtsa brgyad na bskal pa me tog gi 'byung gnas zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the future, after sixty-eight quintillion eons, during the eon called Flower Origin,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas byang chub kyi yan lag me tog ces bya ba sha stag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas byang chub kyi yan lag me tog ces bya ba sha stag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las /
translated: they will all become thus-gone ones, worthy ones, perfect buddhas called Flower of Awakening.

original: sh'a ri'i bu'i le'u ste gnyis pa'o ////
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu'i le'u ste gnyis pa'o ////
translated: This was the second chapter, “Śāriputra,” of “The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / khyod byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las brtsam ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / khyod byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las brtsam ste /
translated: Then the Lord said to the venerable Su­bhūti,

original: ci nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'byung bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos kyi gtam bya bar spobs pa skyed cig /
analyzed: ci nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'byung bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i chos kyi gtam bya bar spobs pa skyed cig /
translated: “Su­bhūti, you should now generate the eloquence to speak about the Dharma in such a way that the bodhisattva great beings will be inspired to practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / nyan thos chen po de dag dang / lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam @118b du sems te /🔽tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'di rang gi shes rab dang spobs pa tsam gyi stobs dang shugs kyi go chas /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / nyan thos chen po de dag dang / lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam @118b du sems te / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor 'di rang gi shes rab dang spobs pa tsam gyi stobs dang shugs kyi go chas /
translated: Then those bodhisattva great beings, those great hearers, and those sons of gods thought this:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston tam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston tam /
translated: “Is the venerable Su­bhūti teaching the perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva great beings through the power and force of his own wisdom and eloquence,🔽or is he teaching through the power of the Buddha?”

original: 'on te sangs rgyas kyi mthus ston par 'gyur snyam pa dang / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: 'on te sangs rgyas kyi mthus ston par 'gyur snyam pa dang / de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti,

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / nyan thos chen po de dag dang / lha'i bu de dag gi sems kyi kun tu rtog pa sems kyis yongs su shes nas /🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la smras pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthus byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / nyan thos chen po de dag dang / lha'i bu de dag gi sems kyi kun tu rtog pa sems kyis yongs su shes nas / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu la smras pa /
translated: through the power of the Buddha, knew the thoughts that had occurred to those bodhisattva great beings, those great hearers, and those sons of gods.🔽He said to the venerable Śāradvatī­putra,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatī­putra!

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams ni gang ci smra'ang rung /🔽gang ci ston kyang rung /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams ni gang ci smra'ang rung / gang ci ston kyang rung /
translated: Whatever the Bhagavān’s śrāvakas say,🔽whatever they teach,

original: gang ci brjod kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gang ci brjod kyang rung ste /
translated: whatever they explain,

original: de thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu'o //
analyzed: de thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu'o //
translated: all of that is the power of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos gang bstan pa de thams cad kyang chos nyid dang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos gang bstan pa de thams cad kyang chos nyid dang mi 'gal lo //
translated: And whatever Dharma the Tathāgata teaches, all of that is not in conflict with the true nature of dharmas.

original: de ltar rigs kyi bu de dag ni chos bstan ba de la slob cing /
analyzed: de ltar rigs kyi bu de dag ni chos bstan ba de la slob cing /
translated: Thus, noble sons, they train in that teaching of the Dharma

original: chos nyid de lta bu mngon du byed do //
analyzed: chos nyid de lta bu mngon du byed do //
translated: and actualize that true nature of dharmas.

original: sh'a radva ti'i bu /🔽'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la /
analyzed: sh'a radva ti'i bu / 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la /
translated: Śāradvatīputra,🔽this is the Tathāgata himself teaching the perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva great beings

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thabs kyis ston pa mdzad kyi /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thabs kyis ston pa mdzad kyi /
translated: by means of skillful means.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a radva ti'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra,🔽the teaching of the perfection of wisdom

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la /
translated: to the bodhisattva great beings

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa ni /
translated: is not the teaching of the perfection of wisdom

original: nyan thos dang / rang @119a *//
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang @119a *//
translated: to the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul ma yin no //
translated: It is not the domain of all the buddhas.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi na / 'di lta ste /
translated: when it is said ‘bodhisattva, bodhisattva,’

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba'am /
translated: what is the word ‘bodhisattva’ a designation for?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba 'di chos gang gi tshig bla dvags lags /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba 'di chos gang gi tshig bla dvags lags /
translated: Is it a designation for the perfection of wisdom?

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bgyi ba'am /
translated: Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba de lta bu bdag gis yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bgyi ba de lta bu bdag gis yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ngo //
translated: I do not see any bodhisattva or perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de ltar bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' de dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming de'ang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong na /
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis byang chub sems dpa' de dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa de dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming de'ang yang dag par rjes su ma mthong na /
translated: when I do not see any bodhisattva, perfection of wisdom, or name of bodhisattva,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni su zhig /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni su zhig /
translated: Who is the bodhisattva great being?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang zhig la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang zhig la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bgyi /
translated: What is the perfection of wisdom that is to be instructed in and enjoined upon?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Lord replied to the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Su­bhūti, it is thus:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming du bya ba de dag ni ming tsam ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming du bya ba de dag ni ming tsam ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom, the bodhisattvas, and the designation ‘bodhisattva’ are mere names.

original: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
analyzed: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
translated: That name does not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: nor does it exist externally,

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //🔽rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so // rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: nor does it abide between the two, nor is it apprehended as non-dual.

original: dper na / sems can sems can zhes bya bar ming du gdags pa'i ming de @119b ni btags pa tsam ste /
analyzed: dper na / sems can sems can zhes bya bar ming du gdags pa'i ming de @119b ni btags pa tsam ste /
translated: Su­bhūti, it is just as, for example, the name ‘sentient being’ is designated for sentient beings, and that name is a mere designation.

original: btags pa'i chos gang yin pa de la ni /
analyzed: btags pa'i chos gang yin pa de la ni /
translated: As for that phenomenon that is a designation,

original: ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
translated: Apart from being mere names and conventional labels, they do not arise or cease.

original: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
analyzed: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
translated: Those names do not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: nor do they exist externally,

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: nor are they apprehended apart from both.

original: bdag dang / srog dang / 'gro ba dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed can dang / shed bdag dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang / slong ba po dang / yongs su slong ba po dang /
analyzed: bdag dang / srog dang / 'gro ba dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed can dang / shed bdag dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa po dang / slong ba po dang / yongs su slong ba po dang /
translated: The self, the life-force, the creature, the nourished being, the person, the individual, the one who lives, the one who lives well, the one who does, the one who makes do, the one who instigates, the one who instigates fully,

original: tshor ba po dang / tshor bar byed pa po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po de dag thams cad kyang btags pa tsam ste /
analyzed: tshor ba po dang / tshor bar byed pa po dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po de dag thams cad kyang btags pa tsam ste /
translated: the one who feels, the one who makes feel, the one who knows, and the one who sees—all of these are mere imputations.

original: btags pa'i chos gang yin pa de la ni ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: btags pa'i chos gang yin pa de la ni ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
translated: As for imputed phenomena, apart from being mere names and conventional labels, they do not arise or cease.

original: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
analyzed: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
translated: Those names do not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: nor do they exist externally,

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: nor are they apprehended apart from both.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang btags pa tsam ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang btags pa tsam ste /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, all these—the perfection of wisdom, the bodhisattva, and the name of a bodhisattva—are mere designations.

original: btags pa'i chos gang yin pa de la ni ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: btags pa'i chos gang yin pa de la ni ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
translated: In the case of a designated phenomenon, apart from being a mere nominal designation, a mere conventional term, there is no arising or ceasing.

original: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
analyzed: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
translated: That name does not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: does not exist externally,

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: and is not apprehended as either of the two.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / nang gi gzugs zhes ming du bya ba ni chos su btags @120a *//🔽pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: dper na / nang gi gzugs zhes ming du bya ba ni chos su btags @120a *// pa tsam du zad de /
translated: The name ‘internal form’ is just a designation for a phenomenon.

original: chos su btags pa de la ni ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: chos su btags pa de la ni ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
translated: In the case of that designated phenomenon, apart from being a mere nominal designation, a mere conventional term, there is no arising or ceasing.

original: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
analyzed: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
translated: That name does not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: does not exist externally,🔽and is not apprehended as either of the two.

original: gnyis la med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis la med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: and it is not apprehended as being other than the two.

original: rab 'byor / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du shes dang / rnam par shes pa zhes ming du bya ba ni chos su gdags pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du shes dang / rnam par shes pa zhes ming du bya ba ni chos su gdags pa tsam du zad de /
translated: “Subhūti, the designation of a dharma as ‘feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness’ is just a designation of a dharma.

original: chos su btags pa de la ni ming dang brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: chos su btags pa de la ni ming dang brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
translated: In that designation of a dharma, apart from a designation by way of a mere name and a mere conventional term, there is no arising and no ceasing.

original: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
analyzed: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
translated: That name does not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: does not exist externally,

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: and is not apprehended as being other than the two.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming dang / chos de dag thams cad ni chos su gdags pa tsam du zad de /🔽chos su btags pa de la ni ming dang brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming dang / chos de dag thams cad ni chos su gdags pa tsam du zad de / chos su btags pa de la ni ming dang brda tsam gyis tha snyad du gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am /
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, the perfection of wisdom, the bodhisattva, the name of a bodhisattva, and all those dharmas are just a designation of a dharma.

original: 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: 'gag pa med de /
translated: In that designation of a dharma, apart from a designation by way of a mere name and a mere conventional term, there is no arising and no ceasing.

original: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
analyzed: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
translated: That name does not exist internally,🔽does not exist externally,🔽and is not apprehended as being other than the two.

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: It is also not outside.

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: It is not apprehended as neither.

original: rab 'byor / mig ces bya ba 'di ni chos su gdags pa tsam du zad de /🔽chos su btags pa de la ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / mig ces bya ba 'di ni chos su gdags pa tsam du zad de / chos su btags pa de la ni 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, this so-called eye is just a label for a phenomenon.

original: mig ces ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: mig ces ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
translated: In that label for a phenomenon, apart from the mere designation by social convention—the mere name and symbol ‘eye’—there is no arising or ceasing.

original: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
analyzed: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
translated: That name does not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: it does not exist externally,

original: @120b gnyis ka med pa yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: @120b gnyis ka med pa yang mi dmigs so //
translated: and it is not apprehended as either of the two.

original: rab 'byor / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ces bya ba 'di ni chos su gdags pa tsam du zad da /🔽chos su btags pa de la ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ces bya ba 'di ni chos su gdags pa tsam du zad da / chos su btags pa de la ni 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, this so-called ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind is just a label for a phenomenon.

original: yid ces ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: yid ces ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
translated: In that label for a phenomenon, apart from the mere designation by social convention—the mere name and symbol ‘thinking mind’—there is no arising or ceasing.

original: ming de ni nang na'ang med //
analyzed: ming de ni nang na'ang med //
translated: That name does not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: it does not exist externally,

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: and it is not apprehended as either of the two.

original: rab 'byor / gzugs zhes bya ba 'di ni chos su gdags pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs zhes bya ba 'di ni chos su gdags pa tsam du zad de /
translated: Subhūti, “form” is just a designation of a phenomenon.

original: chos su btags pa de la ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: chos su btags pa de la ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: In that designation of a phenomenon🔽there is no form

original: gzugs zhes ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs zhes ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am /
translated: other than just a name and a conventional term,

original: 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: 'gag pa med de /
translated: and it is neither produced nor stopped.

original: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
analyzed: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
translated: That name does not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: does not exist externally,

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: and is not apprehended as either of the two.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos zhes bya ba 'di ni chos su gdags pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos zhes bya ba 'di ni chos su gdags pa tsam du zad de /
translated: Subhūti, “sound,” “smell,” “taste,” “feeling,” and “phenomena” are just designations of phenomena.

original: chos su btags pa de la ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: chos su btags pa de la ni 'di lta ste /
translated: In that designation of a phenomenon🔽there is no phenomena

original: chos zhes ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par /
analyzed: chos zhes ming dang brda tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par /
translated: other than just a name and a conventional term,

original: skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
translated: and it is neither produced nor stopped.

original: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
analyzed: ming de ni nang na'ang med /
translated: That name does not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang med /
translated: does not exist externally,🔽and is not apprehended as either of the two.

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so; ;rab 'byor /
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so; ;rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti,

original: mig gi khams zhes bya ba 'di ni chos su gdags pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: mig gi khams zhes bya ba 'di ni chos su gdags pa tsam du zad de /
translated: The so-called eye constituent is merely a designation for a dharma.

original: chos su btags pa de la ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: chos su btags pa de la ni / 'di lta ste /
translated: That dharma designation

original: mig gi khams zhes ming dang brda @121a *//

original: tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: tsam du tha snyad kyis gdags pa ma gtogs par skye ba'am 'gag pa med de /

original: ming de ni nang na'ang med /

translated: That name does not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang med /
